cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move slowly northwest near the Florida east coast, then curve northward and accelerate northeast parallel to the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the South Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from north of Deerfield Beach FL to south of Lantana FL and Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC; Hurricane Watch north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL and north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA; Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts, extending northward toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into early Saturday; gusty 25–35 kt winds possible if the storm’s track shifts westward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Chesapeake Bay or Baltimore Harbor with current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rainfall Friday–Saturday; heavy totals unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Atlantic beaches; minor coastal flooding at times of high tide possible.
